ygData.subject: RE: skills
ygData.msgSnippet: I really don t think so, but I haven t tried it. A skill cap is exactly what it says, a cap. Dodge is one of our warrior-inherited traits. We are not supposed
ygData.messageBody:
I really don't think so, but I haven't tried it. A skill cap is exactly what
it says, a cap. Dodge is one of our warrior-inherited traits. We are not
supposed to be as good as Warriors in this area, thus the cap. For dark elf
clerics, our "Hide" skill never goes up past "Below Average", it is a
race-inherited skill.

But if you try it please post your results.


Drizben D'Vorn
Defiled Priest of Innoruuk
Propagator of Hate


> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> Even if I spend points into it? Has anyone tried that? I think I
> might do it. I'm pretty sure it still shows up on my training screen
> when I go to the guildmaster. Seems like I could spend the plat and
> raise it. It will certainly let me. I'll try it sometime, let the
> list know what happens.
>
>
> >From: AoS/Aosinator <darshan@...>
> >
> > >It's 75, actually. Can I take it past 75 by spending training points?
> > >You didn't answer my question.
> >
> >The maximum that a cleric can attain in dodge, is 75 I believe. Once it
> >reaches it's maximum, it can go no higher.
> >
> >
> >-Aosinator Lightbringer
> >-Devout follower of Mithaniel Marr on The Rathe
